website_summaries.verdict: As a drug-free option, many customers find Sea-Bands to work well using wrist pressure.
pros: This pair of cotton, non-latex bracelets are a good alternative to motion sickness medications
Bracelets use acupressure to relieve motion sickness and nausea
Comes with a plastic carrying case
cons: Sea-Bands do not work for everyone, and they may be too snug for some wrists

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for Vertigo
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this for the third time not because it is a great idea because I wear them 24 hours a day seven days a week I suffer from extreme vertigo and having these on I have no vertigo whatsoever they say not to wear them all the time but I say screw them if it works do it!
customer_reviews.author: C51

customer_reviews.title: WORK GREAT - I WAS SKEPTICAL TOO!
customer_reviews.text: I get VERY sea sick and these worked like a CHARM during my cruise. Whenever I put them on, my nausea went away in minutes. When I took them off, I felt sick almost instantly. They do leave an imprint on your wrists but that is nothing compared to the relief they provide. I was skeptical of their effectiveness before buying but TRUST ME, they work wonders.
customer_reviews.author: ninakraw

customer_reviews.title: I can function again
customer_reviews.text: It’s all fun and games until you don’t leave your bathroom...thank goodness for these sea bands. I leave them on almost all the time (I take them off to shower and sometimes forget to put them back on after) and my body never takes long to remind me when I’ve forgotten. It doesn’t take away ALL the nausea, but they certainly serve their purpose in a safe, natural way. Perfect for pregnancy. If I could I’d give them an extra half star. Buy them!!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing as a sleep aid
customer_reviews.text: I use them to help me sleep at night. For the first time in months, I am able to return to sleep when I wake during the night. It's amazing how well they work for this purpose! I highly recommend trying them if you have trouble sleeping and don't want to take drugs.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great for morning sickness during pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought these for our cruise not knowing that they would be basically an icky sweatband with a uncomfortable ball on the inside of our wrist, so we absolutely didn't even bring them on our cruise.. BUT, now in pregnant and have been feeling so miserable that I can hardly get out of bed all day. And I randomly thought of putting this sea bands on and it's like magic!! I feel normal! So I totally suggest these for pregnancy hahaha!
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend if you suffer from motion sickness!
customer_reviews.text: I get motion sickness fairly easily and since I bought these I have not thrown up on a plane once! Between these bands and a ginger pill I feel ready to tackle a plane, boat, or long car trip.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: not a lot of information given
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of these for my daughter (who is 9), so I assumed the child size would fit her. They arrived and they are so small, they look like they would fit an infants wrist. There are no size dimensions at all in the description. And the other thing that is not right...they say colors vary. Again, understand that, but of course we got the camo colored ones, again....for my daughter. Not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Biller

customer_reviews.title: You can not choose children’s color 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: We received our bands today and were excited to use them for our up coming road trip. We have a 5 year old BOY who experiences car sickness but when I opened the package we received pink camo bands. I am so sad because I am not sure if he will have any part of pink wrist bands. Bummer, I wish the were all neutral or you could select the color. I may have to change my review if I can get him to wear them and they work. 🤞🏻Just a disappointing start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAKE PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Took weeks to arrive. Weren't real seabands. They were knock off, fake seabands wrapped in plastic not the real product packaging. The wristbands stretched out quickly and became ragged and loose after 2 uses. Once they are loose - they don't work anymore. Garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: So i got a bunch of pregnancy things for my friend who has extreme morning sickness. Im talking, sick all day, all night, going to the doctor, passing out, cant eat, cant even have ice, it was awful. I ordered a bunch of morning sickness candies, pops and these wristbands to try. She tried all of them and some of the candies were nice but these by far were the best. She doesnt even take them off now and she can eat again. She is somewhat returned to normal. Get these. Its worth a shot. Im so glad i was able to help her.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemaryc5

customer_reviews.title: Very, Very tight.  Does not fit an adult.
customer_reviews.text: I was so hoping these wrist bands would work for me. But I will never know because they are too tight for my wrists. And I have very small wrists! I think the package was mismarked because there is no way they are Adult size. I purchased two packages, but will not be able to use either as both packages say Adult, but are too small. I guess I will just have to take motion sickness pills for my upcoming cruise. Would have liked to have tried this method. I am disappointed. Additional comment, this item cannot be returned. So now I cannot return and receive a credit. Very disappointed even more so now.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderlust

customer_reviews.title: Colors Vary
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was ordering the blue as is the picture but now that I read the heading more clearly, i see colors may vary. Now I am stuck with a pink camo pair for my son. Also, now when I open the link the price is less than half of what I paid and that is super frustrating especially since I got the one color he hates.
customer_reviews.author: spiffyv

customer_reviews.title: Great as a daily supplement! Handy pocket-sized packs!
customer_reviews.text: Ginger is soooo good for you & this gum is a perfect way to keep ginger in your diet as a daily supplement and perfect for motion sickness or just a little upset stomach. Better tasting than ANY OTHER ginger chews or gum I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I have ever purchased IN MY LIFE
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I have ever purchased IN MY LIFE. I purchased one pair for my 1.5 y/o. No longer do we have to pull over every 10 miles to either "get some air" or clean up a vomit explosion. These things are a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical but it made me a believer!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 yr old has got sick in the truck ever since he was born. I've tried everything to keep him from getting sick from medications to simply not going anywhere. I thought I'd try this and was so surprised that he didn't get sick, we use it everytime we go and there's only been twice he's got sick and that's out of at least 50 times so I'd sayit does work! He does say that it hurts a little bit and it does leave a bit of a red mark on his wrist but it goes away after about 10 to15 min, much better than him getting sick and feeling miserable. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: A huge help during 1st trimester
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these to help me through the dreaded first trimester. I was skeptical at first thinking bands couldn’t take away the dreaded nausea I was having. Well, it didn’t necessarily take all the nausea away but what it did do was make the nausea bearable so I could make it through a day at work. They were comfortable and I was easily able to wear them under my work tops and barely anyone noticed I had them on. I wore them pretty much from the minute I got up until I went to bed. They were a huge lifesaver for me!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for morning sickness - tried for multiple weeks
customer_reviews.text: These did not work for me at all for my pregnancy morning sickness. My wrists are small, so I bought a child size to ensure a tight fit. I left them on starting at 8.5 weeks until 10.5 weeks, but they did not do anything. I even looked into the proper position, and tried a few different positions for extended periods of time - with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Youknoewhat

customer_reviews.title: Great for chemo patients.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a friend undergoing chemo. I personally tried them while I was pregnant and couldn't be in the car without them. I love that it is a very natural and easy option to reduce nausea symptoms. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a alternative to meds for nausea relief.
customer_reviews.author: MommaDawnF

customer_reviews.title: My carsick friend loves this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this twice as a gift for a teenage friend who loves travel but not the motion sickness that goes along with it. Apparently the ginger gum quells the nausea and queasiness effectively. Will order again before his next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Martha W. Bonney

customer_reviews.title: For small wrists only
customer_reviews.text: These bands used to be made for adults but the manufacturers seem to have reduced the size slightly so they are tight on normal wrists although they look the same as the old version. We have used motion bands for decades and never had problems with those purchased years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Pompom

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: Gum works really well for nausea, For me I chew 2 at a time, works great then. Doesn’t stick to teeth, tasty. Only complaint is the cost, wish it was more reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Chronic nausea became easier to control and cut back on rx’s that were making me feel over medicated
customer_reviews.text: Severe chronic nausea taking two double dose prescription nausea meds 3x day doesn’t work well and I feel over medicated and hangover feeling constantly so I found these and while they don’t cure me, it’s so much better and I was able to cut back on rx’s, I also suggest aromatherapy to help with chronic nausea, mint helps me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE. The first time I took these out of ...
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE. The first time I took these out of the package and put them on my small daughter's wrist, one of the little plastic balls that is supposed to work on the pressure point popped off completely and went flying. I was gentle with the wrist bands and my daughter does not have big hands--we were not over-stretching the wristband at all. Cheaply made and useless from the first second we got them out.
customer_reviews.author: happyreader

customer_reviews.title: Probably a placebo...
customer_reviews.text: I wore them for a whole day of travel and thought it worked! But when I took them off, I saw that the bead was about a centimeter off all day! To be fair, the placebo effect DOES work, and I didn't feel carsick all day! But I don't think it works the way they claim :)
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Li

customer_reviews.title: Its possible that my nausea just wasn't as bad on the days that I used these
customer_reviews.text: These seemed to give some relief to my chemo induced nausea. Its possible that my nausea just wasn't as bad on the days that I used these, so I can't say for sure. I do feel that they helped some, so I am giving them 5 stars. Even if it was just psychological help, it got me through some rough times.
customer_reviews.author: PC Henjin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't use them much as I had trouble positioning them correctly
customer_reviews.text: These seemed to help my nausea, the first time I put them on, but mostly for me, and it's probably just me, I have heard from others that these worked great for them, they just got uncomfortable. I spent a lot of time after the first couple uses adjusting, trying to figure out if I had them positioned right, or trying to relieve the discomfort.. again that is probably just me.. I don't always like things to be tight on my wrist and these are a bit snug.
customer_reviews.author: Eleah

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nice to know what color we would receive
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice to know what color we would receive, but thats my only complaint. My 5 year old son got the pink color but it did seem to work well. He was able to press the plastic piece on the band into the pressure point as needed on our drives to alleviate nausea. Seems like a great alternative to giving them medicine.
customer_reviews.author: A E

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could say these worked...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product, but maybe my expectations were too high. I bought them in hopes they would lessen my pregnancy induced nausea. They didn't work for me. I tried to reposition the bands several times, trying to make sure it wasn't a user error... They never did anything for my nausea. They just really hurt my wrists after wearing them for an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Brought these bands on a cruise ship vacation. We encountered choppy waters on the Atlantic. I immediately put on the bands at the first announcement that we would be having a bumpy ride. Though I followed instructions as listed, the wrist bands did not work to prevent or eliminate motion sickness for me. Friends tell me one needs to take medicine together with wearing bands for them to be effective. Medicine alone was sufficient for me. The bands work for some people but were not at all successful for me.
customer_reviews.author: Musicista

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because so many people suggest them and I think they are garbage. I wore them on the airplane and all they did was cut off my circulation. It’s just an acupuncture type of thing and I regret wasting my money. Tried again on our boat ride and I was still vomiting. I suggest bonine pills for anyone who struggles with sea sickness not these bands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great tastes good if u like ginger
customer_reviews.text: Works great can tell it's ginger has a strong taste but I use it whenever I'm nauseous always works even when I should have let myself throw up like food poison
customer_reviews.author: LJG

customer_reviews.title: One of them was damaged but impossible to return
customer_reviews.text: I recieved a pack of two wristbands and one of them was damaged. This item is not eligible for return, but I couldn’t wear it because the scratches on the inner side of the ball were damaging my skin. As far as nausea goes , I could just wear 1 instead of 2 wristbands so I can’t tell if it really worked . I still woke up with nausea and had to take my medication since I was not sure how long it is supposed to take till the nasty feeling of morning sickness will go away. Also the wristband is pretty tight and leaves marks on the skin
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first time....
customer_reviews.text: Got these for constant nausea in my first trimester. They seemed to work great the first time I used them, so much so that I didn't want to take them off! But they are supposed to be quite tight and after 24 hrs they start to get uncomfortable and looks like long term wear might actually cause some possible skin damage, just guessing on that. But I've tried using them 3 or 4 more times and they don't really seem to work as well as that first time...not sure why. But if you're as desperate as I was for nausea relief, I would say for the price they are worth a shot.
customer_reviews.author: AppleAvenger🍎

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Royal Caribbean cruise trip during Christmas. It did not work when the boat started to waving around on the way back. The cruise is one of the largest in the world (allure of the sea), so that it is pretty stable. The movement was not significant, the rest of my family was just without any help. I ended up taking the motion sickness medicine, which worked right away.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Hart

customer_reviews.title: Helps ease morning sickness
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for morning sickness. I think that they do help alleviate some of the nausea. You have to make sure you place them correctly on your wrists. It’s honestly worth a shot to try these if you are feeling ill. I work from home so for me it’s not necessary to hide them but for those who need to be discreet this would be hard to hide in the summer months. It takes a while to get use to wearing them as they will leave indentations on your wrists.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: ... used these before on a cruise and they worked great. I now have had extreme vertigo with nausea ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these before on a cruise and they worked great. I now have had extreme vertigo with nausea and vomiting. This was completely incapacitating. After 4 hospital visits they determined it was a crystal dislodged in my ear (who knew there are crystals in your ear). I used scopolamine patches but developed an allergy to the adhesive. Trust me you don't want the skin behind your ear constantly bleeding So, I remembered using these in the past. They absolutely worked for me. Have not experienced any dizziness or nausea since using them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bussell

customer_reviews.title: Zero 0 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't help my morning sickness at all.. it just adds a painful discomfort because the ball presses into your skin leaving you feeling sore and bruised... if the bands actually worked i wouldnt mind dealing with this affect but since it does absolutely nothing but cause pain i give it 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.C

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for a cruise in May. I am not sure if they worked or not, but they were tight on my small wrists. I was wearing them properly. I still have a mark on one arm from wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not one size fits all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for morning sickness and it really seemed to help... for about 6 weeks. It's not something you can wear everyday/ all the time. The bands are very tight and my wrists start to ache after awhile. Side note: it doesn't help with nausea from the flu but it helped with morning sickness and motion sickness. The package says they are washable but I have not washed them yet... wish it came with a small wash bag.
customer_reviews.author: cooperstar

customer_reviews.title: Too Snug
customer_reviews.text: Although I understand that these need to fit snuggly, they were way too tight and uncomfortable for me and my teenage son. I actually have pretty dainty wrists and I can't imagine what they would feel like on someone with larger wrists. We scrapped these the first half hour we had them on and they left pretty decent marks all around our wrist. We used the motion sickness patches instead and those kept us feeling good!
customer_reviews.author: TrustnChrist

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss for me
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea and I was desperate for anything that might work due to nausea/vomiting of pregnancy . I can’t really tell if it worked. Maybe just took the edge off. Only used for a week as I had to take prescription medication and so didn’t need it anymore. I would recommend if you’re struggling. They won’t hurt so why not and they’re not expensive. You do have to wear both of them and they are tight so they leave indentations on wrists. I did stretch them a bit in the beginning and they felt fine after.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: A miracle product!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from terrible motion sickness on airplanes, boats, amusement park rides, and sometimes in cars. I bought these bands in hopes they would help me on a flight from Texas to England to Ireland. I've used medication in the past with mixed results. But nothing has ever stopped the nausea altogether. Nothing but these wrist bands, that is. I didn't have a single moment of sickness whatsoever. I combined them with Dramamine. I felt great the entire flight and even ate a full meal, something I never would have dared in the past. They worked equally as well on the return trip, even through some pretty severe turbulence.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any nausea
customer_reviews.text: I was given this gum from a stranger on a Hawaiian catamaran. I was violently sea sick and two tabs of this gum absolutely saved me. I swear by it. I am easily nauseated from car rides and airplanes as well. I keep this gum in my purse and in my glove compartment. I suffer from migraines which result in nausea and chewing this gum helps a huge deal. While it does not cure the migraine, it seems to distract my body and help ease my stomach during an intense flare. I cannot say one negative thing about this gum. Sea sick, car sick, migraine induced nausea, I 100% recommend this gum.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what voodoo this is but they really do work
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these about 10 years ago from a doctor when I was going to a theme park. They work. I mean yes they do feel a bit wierd on your wrist for awhile but you get use to them. As I've gotten older I have needed these more and more for riding in a car or rides at Disney. I highly recommend if you still want to do all the stuff but don't want to end up green and laying on the floor regretting that Star Tours ride
customer_reviews.author: Auburn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: Envious of all these happy reviewers below. This didn't work for me at all. I take half a Dramamine before every flight and was so happy to experiment with these bands. Unfortunately, they did nothing, despite trying to adjust them after reading and re-reading the alignment instructions. I was sick the entire flight and decided I can't chance it again. I gave another pair to my Grandmother who suffers from Vertigo and it did nothing for her, either. My daughter (13 years old) tried them and said she didn't feel sick on the flight so I suppose it's a win for her. Lucky girl....
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lopez

customer_reviews.text: Oh. Em. Gee. Thank God for these ugly little things. I went on my first cruise a year ago with no seasickness. My hubby however got it and we didn’t really have anything to help and regretted it. So for our second cruise this year, I bought these based off a recommendation from a pregnant friend who said they helped with morning sickness. My lovely hubby felt great on this cruise, but I was not so lucky this time! I got seasick almost every night and these things were LIFESAVERS! I’m on Team Sea-Band now!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Arseneau

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work... my only complaint is ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work...my only complaint is that the bands were too tight. I'm 5'3" with medium size wrists. Wore then most of the day for severe vertigo. I had to take them off early evening because they bands were so tight.
customer_reviews.author: CRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Life (& trip) saver
customer_reviews.text: I think this very unassuming product was one of the only reasons why I wasn't hurling during a boat trip a while ago. It was a pretty rough trip, and I had these on almost the whole time. It might have been mental - "if you think it helps, then it will", but I usually did feel better having them on than not. Only problem was that it was kinda hard for me to get them aligned on the right spot each time, and they sometimes would feel too tight & hurt, so I was constantly moving the dot around anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Yi

customer_reviews.title: They Work!
customer_reviews.text: Well, at least I think they work. My husband has used these on numerous cruises along with Meclizine (active ingredient in Bonine). The combination works for him. He wears the Sea-Bands faithfully for the entire cruise and has had no problems even in some very rough and high seas. Before Sea-Bands and Meclizine, he used to get sea sick. He will not cruise without his Sea-Bands.
customer_reviews.author: L L

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Super skeptical but I had no other recourse bc my youngest daughter is a year and a half now and would vomit on a three-minute car ride to the park! It made taking her anywhere very anxiety-riddled! Bc she would 🤮 excessively .. fully empty her stomach, not just spit-up.. but this is a game-changer.. now she can finally run errands with me..we have a two-hour drive next mth, can’t wait to see how she does ..
customer_reviews.author: Latoya

customer_reviews.title: Nausea during pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: These things work so amazingly well for nausea during pregnancy. I bought myself 2 pair just in case and i suggest them to everyone i know. 10/10 fantastic product
customer_reviews.author: sarah b.

customer_reviews.title: Cruise drunk bands
customer_reviews.text: On my cruise, i Drunk 5 cups of rum punch. I tried to go to sleep in my cabin, but the room was spinning. Drunk and spinning room is a sign of " bitch your about to throw up". I was determine not to throw up, so my ass decided to put my sea band on ! Let me tell you , those bands work and my ass was knocked out and i didnt throw up ! A must have bands
customer_reviews.author: Venasia Settles

customer_reviews.title: Ok so far
customer_reviews.text: They came blue..which i figured after seeing other reviews I wouldnt know what I was getting. My daughter is 7 and ok with the blue. Shes been taking childrens dramamine since she was 3 and has terrible car sickness. We are trying to keep her from being so drowsy from the meds bc we cant go anywhere without dramamine. We wore these over the weekend without meds and she did good! They are a little difficult to position on a tiny wrist but we pretty much get them in the general area. Hoping to use these for car rides not involving the school bus. One step at a time.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: My son says they work!
customer_reviews.text: I have a four year old son who gets car sick when we travel in the car for more than 20 minutes. He justs feels bad, doesnt throw up or anything but really gets upset. I bought these because i didn't want to medicate him. I tried these and happy to report it works! We have had them 6 months have used them maybe 20 times and everytime he stops complaining. I keep them in the car and now its to the point where he says " Mama i need my wristband" and i give it to him and he is fine within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you suffer with motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I didn't invest in these years ago. I get horrible car sickness to the point I have to lay in the car for about 20 mins after the car ride [as a passenger] before the feeling goes away. These simple wristbands have made such a huge difference in my life! I actually get to enjoy looking at the scenery now in new places. I have to be honest in saying that for the most part they work fantastic! However, for me, when I'm hungry and in the car they don't help as much. I still get a little sick but nothing like when I don't have them on.
customer_reviews.author: Sjix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for traveling and helped me survive my Europe trip! I appreciated that it came with a short how-to-use instructions. The wristbands are very small and fits easily in any pocket. I used it while riding in the backseat of a car, traveling on a plane, and riding trains, and all 3 times I felt fine. Without these, I would've gotten major nausea, headache, and indigestion. Although they leave some pressure marks if you wear them for a couple hours, it will eventually go away. However, I have not tried it while taking a boat ride so I can't speak for that.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, Says the Wife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my pregnant wife as a way to help with morning sickness and general nausea throughout the day in her first trimester. She didn't think it really helped bbbbuuuutttt didn't like the location where they put pressure. She said they made her feel uncomfortable. Not saying this won't work for you but she didn't like it. She only wears a watch, though, and tends to avoid tight-fitting items around her writs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Helton

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: I realize that these don't work for everyone, but if you have pregnancy nausea it's totally worth the $8 to try it out. I'm living in mine until 2nd trimester. So glad they work for me. They are pretty snug on the wrist, and I have small wrists, so it can be uncomfortable at first, but the discomfort is nothing compared to the nausea. You get used to them and don't even feel them after a bit. They seem to kick in if you're already nauseous is 15-20mins. I'm wondering if these might also be great for hangovers! When the day comes, I'm trying it!
customer_reviews.author: Jannalkinney

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t get nauseous!
customer_reviews.text: I get BAD motion sickness on flights and boats. Important note: sometimes dramamine (motion sickness medicine) doesn’t always work for me, so I wore these wristbands in conjunction with taking a dramamine on my 12 hour flight, and I didn’t get sick. Not sure if the wristbands were responsible, but it’s worth a shot! I also wore these on an 8 hour boat ride along with dramamine and I didn’t feel any nausea. Again, I’m not sure if these have any effect on me, but it can’t hurt to buy and try them! I would still take an over the counter motion sickness medicine just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an upcoming cruise, but thought I would try them out when flying (as I tend to get motion sickness even after taking Dramamine). I was very surprised that I had no motion sickness after wearing these on 2 different work trips. I also took these on a cruise and only had to use them once. Once I felt the motion sickness coming on, I put on the bands and the sickness was gone in about 15 minutes. They came in a nice plastic case and are reusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Gimmicky
customer_reviews.text: I had read several reviews on these before purchasing and decided to try them for morning sickness. They did not work for me. I followed the instructions and placed them as guided. I wore them for a week and had no difference. I will try again with a long drive as I get mostion sickness easily but I am not convinced they do anything at all.
customer_reviews.author: MHurt

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work!
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure, I used this in conjunction with a prescription Scopolamine patch. I was crossing the drakes passage on the way to Antarctica and I get VERY sea sick, so I wanted every tool I could get. I do think they helped a little (though I think the patch did the heavy hitting here). The patch has side effects though, so in future if going on a smaller boat trip or something in calmer waters, I do think that these would be helpful and will try them out. I also like the compact little carrying case they come in.
customer_reviews.author: JSF

customer_reviews.title: These were okayyyy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in my first trimester of pregnancy because I heard that it helps with nausea. I was expecting it to help a lot more than it did. I used them when I flew on a plane in my first trimester as well. I used them consistently and they still helped some, but if you're buying these with hopes of nausea to completely go away in pregnancy, that probably won't happen. Also, if you haven't heard of or used this before, they are very small and can be kind of painful after leaving them on for several hours, but they do help, so pick your struggle haha.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Carey

customer_reviews.title: These worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: These bands are amazing. I was really skeptical about this item, but because of narrow angle glaucoma, I cannot use regular anti-nausea meds. Within 30 minutes or less my vertigo nausea was gone. I learned about the anxiety reducing effect kind of by accident. I left them on all day and I had kind of a calming effect from them the next morning. I usually wake up with mild low grade anxiety, but noticed it wasn't there. Going to purchase more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Cured my morning sickness
customer_reviews.text: I had horrific morning sickness- day and night. The can’t eat- can’t sleep- can’t get out of bed kind. During one of my recent hospital stays a nurse recommended these bands. She mentioned it worked for someone she knew and I honestly didn’t think much about it. As a last resort, I ordered the bands and tried em. HOLY GOODNESS! They work. I’ve been wearing them for almost a week (I take them off only to shower) and I can actually function. My morning sickness is almost completely gone... I feel normal again. I highly recommend them for anyone with morning sickness.. I think they’re $6 bucks so definitely give it a try. They worked for me almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie & Chad

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Sea-Bands for our group taking a cruise thinking the seas would be rough due to a hurricane to the north of us and one to the south. Unfortunately, the bands for each adult were very tight and cut off circulation. My wrist were the smallest of the group and they even extremely tight for me. So, no one ended up wearing them at all after realizing how restrictive they were. The bands should be snug but not so snug that they cut off circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gma

customer_reviews.title: The Best Motion (Anything) Sickness Thing There Is!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how many of these I buy. They used to be for me (for car sickness) but now I always keep some on hand for everyone. One pair went with my SO when he had a stomach thing (helped him make it home without having to stop). One pair for my youngest when he gets car sick. I've given a pair to a friend with morning sickness. You seriously cannot believe how well these things work on everything. They come in a cute case to keep you from losing them which is great. But I always have a set in my car or purse for when you need them! Such a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Superstefmom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cure for nausea
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing band for nausea or anxiety. It’s very light weight and you don’t even notice you have it on.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: My 8 yr old can't wear these bc they are too tight. They look like they would fit a newborn but I understand they have to press on the pressure point to help her. But they were way too small and uncomfortable for her. Didn't even wear them one time. I hear these work great though. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jenny Russo

customer_reviews.title: It works?
customer_reviews.text: I wore these on my last cruise and I didn't feel the wooziness that I normally feel on the ship. Don't know if its a placebo effect? Knowing that they would help and they did? After a while the pressure point ball fells like its digging into your skin. They leave a nice indention in your wrist, but I kept on wearing them. I was only taking them off when the ship was moving slow or going to bed. I will be using again for my next cruise.
customer_reviews.author: Phooey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered wristbands for my motion sickness about 30 years ago. I recently purchased these for my 10 year old great nephew who gets very carsick. His parents couldn’t believe how well they worked! Neither could my great nephew, he was so excited not to get sick on the long 9 hour car drive to see his cousins. I definitely recommend these! No pills (or throw up bags) needed!
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: Amazing even for a skeptic
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely skeptic this product would deliver the claims of other reviewers, but I figured I might as well try it. First, I LOVE the tiny plastic case because it keeps both bands together, so no loosing one. Second, I wore these things on a 14+ hour long car trip. aMAZiNg! I haven't gotten to read in the car since I was eight years old due to motion sickness. I had no problems. The only thing I did notice is after about 5 hours of continuous use, my pressure points were slightly sore, but a much better side effect than what I normally have. I would recommend these bands to anyone who suffers.
customer_reviews.author: Mld0203

customer_reviews.title: This helped me on a astronomical level
customer_reviews.text: Pregnancy week 6-9 was pure vomit hell. I couldn’t move without being nauseous. Once I threw these bad boys on (you have to wear both) I was able to actually get up and move around without feeling seasick and vomiting every 3 minutes. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: M Rios

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: The longest stretch off the couch I had was 20 minutes before I got these for morning sickness. Mine was all day sickness. I was worried about going back to my classroom after Thanksgiving break but these are a lifesaver. I'd say they take about 75%-90% of my nausea away throughout the day. I can function at work and actually eat something other than crackers and toast.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: There not bad
customer_reviews.text: There’s no “flavor” not sure why that’s an option. These work well for car trips if you get nauseous and they work when your feeling queasy but not so much when you are actually nauseous they work a little with morning sickness but if you mix lemon juice in water and sip of that every time you are feeling morning sickness that should help more bc it’s keeping you hydrated and with sooth your stomach
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sturgill

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: Next time I'm just ordering the patches. Bought these for a cruise and knew the waters might be a little rough... These were kind of like a torture device after the first day. They were super tight on my wrists, which are relatively slim, and left divots in my wrists and I was sore/tender in those spots for days after removing them. I get they need to be tight for them to hit that nerve or whatever but holy cow these were NOT comfortable. I'll be ordering the patches that go behind the ear next time for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Maxam

customer_reviews.title: Even on the train that went on the ship, WORKED!!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a long history of traveling and getting sick, you know how miserable you are. I learned to put myself to sleep by age 6, to avoid reading (boring), and not to navigate for others. On a boat (worst) or car(unless the driver) or plane (landings suck) I have tested out these bands, they work! On the way to Copenhagen our train went on a ship, my son and I charged down five decks to get our Sea-bands... and they worked!
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Kicked my morning sickness’ butt!
customer_reviews.text: By far A GOD SEND. I swear I was second guessing ever getting pregnant because my nausea was debilitating. I wanted to cry daily, I could barley work it was awful. Within 5 minutes of wearing these bands I felt like my old self. NO JOKE. I feel like I need to buy these in stock. If you are suffering from morning sickness or in my case all day everyday sickness DO NOT HESISTATE to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Not even worried about the money, my time was wasted. Trash
customer_reviews.text: Bogus. These things are so tight my hands turn purple from lack of oxygen. They are itchY, cheaply made and if you don’t know EXACTLY where to put it what’s the point.?! It’s a trigger point therapy tool for nausea that doesn’t trigger any exact point. Waste of money and time opening.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Bienvenu

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These are STUPID. They do absolutely nothing at all. Was trying to use for nausea but ended up just wasting my money. Thankfully when I went to return these they said i didn’t need to send them back and just refunded my money. That was nice I didn’t have to go through the ordeal of mailing it back when I’ll most likely end up just throwing them in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Allowed me to sleep on a cruise.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these before a cruise. I don't usually experience motion sickness but wanted to be prepared. I am glad I did, I used them one night when I felt slightly uneasy. The next morning I took them off and did not need them for the rest of the trip. Do I think they worked? Yes. Would I rebuy them? Yes. It's a small amount of money spent to ensure a great trip.
customer_reviews.author: Tom HightowerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I had to take a non-stop flight across the US and I really dreaded the turbulence and air sickness I usually feel on these trips. I don't like taking medication and found an article about these bands and so I thought I would give them a try. They are simply amazing! I did not expect them to work as well as they had, I will never travel without them again.
customer_reviews.author: Charity Rue

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My friend gave me my first set and they are just a life saver so I had to buy another! I lived on an island for many years and had to take a boat often and got very sea sick these bad boys along with a ginger chew do the trick. I have 1 set in my boyfriends car and the other in my travel bag. It’s a cheap and effective way to keep your self feeling good! Side note the case is also super handy!
customer_reviews.author: WrenLisa

customer_reviews.title: Tiny wrists, still painfully small
customer_reviews.text: They literally made me.more nauseous, and caused me so much pain. I'm pretty sure they were pinching nerves. They left angry red indentations because they were ridiculously tight, even though my wrists are tiny! 6 inches around.
customer_reviews.author: nova

customer_reviews.title: Fast relief and effective preventative!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but given the low price I figured it was worth a try. They WORK! We drove for a total of 5 days round trip and I did not get sick once while wearing these! The same was true for my daughter. I’ve even used them when feeling nauseated around the house. The best thing is you only need to wear one to get the benefit, so I keep one in my car and one in the house. As someone who experiences motion sickness from simply rocking in a rocking chair or swinging on a porch swing, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Cash

customer_reviews.title: I'm the Ultimate Skeptic..BUT THESE THINGS WORK
customer_reviews.text: I get terrible sea sickness, and am on a cruise in the South Pacific. The waters have been ROUGH, so I pulled out the Sea Bands I bought - out of desperation. The not only stopped my queasiness but have prevented me from getting seasick when everyone else around me has been. Even my husband, who thought I was imaging their effectiveness, gave them a try - and he's now a believer too.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute game changer. My six and eight-year-old went on a half-day boat fishing and I was concerned they were going to get sick because my youngest always gets carsick when we go on a road trip. But he wasn’t even affected. They worked great. That makes me really happy because we love to be on the water. Great value for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Legit resolves motion sickness when using 3D games
customer_reviews.text: These little things are fantastic and perfect for traveling. While I'd love to travel, I actually bought these for those ridiculous 3D video games that are overkill on animation. I noticed if I don't have them in the correct spot I still do get headaches/nausea, but it's a quick easy fix once you get the general spot down. I have pretty small wrists and these fit me very comfortably without hurting for hours on end. I also suggest modifying the game settings to allow for minimal sickness. These have allowed me to game again! heck yes!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mel

customer_reviews.title: Hurts, but Works
customer_reviews.text: These bands are seriously tiny and I have very small wrists. By the end of the day, I have indentions in my arm that are very tender to the touch. I can’t imagine someone with larger wrists using them and not being in pain. With that being said, I really do think they work. I’m 8 weeks pregnant and threw up a week ago, was constantly nauseous everyday all day, but as soon as I started these I felt so much better. I had horrible “morning sickness” with my first two pregnancies and wish I would’ve known about these. For me, the pain of wearing them is well worth it to keep my meals down for myself and my baby.
customer_reviews.author: madisonfaith199918

customer_reviews.title: They really work!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate taking meds for car sickness. Went on a cruise with some terrible waters and these actually worked!! Make sure to read the instructions because they go 3 finger widths under the wrist. I even had to use them at night because normally when you sleep the feeling goes away but wouldn’t for me. Slipped these on again and slept like a baby without an upset stomach. Thanks for saving my vacation!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: They worked like magic for me and a lot of people on ...
customer_reviews.text: Would rate these a 10 if I could. They worked like magic for me and a lot of people on our cruise. I put them on whenever I felt queasy and they worked like a charm (if it was the placebo effect, I'll take it).
customer_reviews.author: K. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this mumbo jumbo
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was some sort of medicated bracelet. It is just a plastic nub that sticks into your wrist and supposedly heals you. Doesn't seem to do anything.
customer_reviews.author: K & A

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have found something that works for our family! I hate having to take medication to help with car rides especially having to give the kiddeos meds. My fam gets sick darn near instantly in the car to include me who drives everywhere. No I'm not a crazy driver we just get bad motion sickness, but these bands have been a miracle for us so far no ones puked or had that terrible nausea feeling! You will not regret fits my kids 4,6,14 an myself perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Harper

customer_reviews.title: Helped morning sickness
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my morning sickness. They were a life saver!! Although I was still sick at times, I could tell a huge difference when I wore them over long periods of time. I know they don’t work for everyone, but I would recommend at least trying them. You won’t be out too much money if they don’t work! I’ll be saving mine for future pregnancies.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: They do the job! Just wish the colors weren't random.
customer_reviews.text: Long road trips make my kids nauseous. It has NOTHING to do with my driving, I swear! These Sea-Band wristbands were ordered to help them enjoy our trips without feeling sick or relying on nausea medications. They were easy to slip on and seem to have done the job, as our first two long road trips were sickness free. My only concern is that the colors of the bands can't be chosen. We ended up with two pair of green camouflage bands that just don't jive with the rest of my sons' fashion.
customer_reviews.author: JoeE

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bands mostly for airplane travel and most recently went to Peru where altitude sickness is very common among tourist. I could not have been happier with this product. I wore them both, one on each wrist and I would completely forget I had them on since they are not uncomfortable to wear. I did not get sick in the plane (which I always do) and neither did I get dizzy during our travel. Even locals would be shocked we (my husband and I) were not feeling sick or dizzy after 6 hr flight and hiking up the mountains. Recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Garcia

customer_reviews.title: They work!! When used right though.
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old daughter gets car sick. It’s awful because she wants to read book so badly on car drives but it makes her totally nauseous. These fixed that!! I was skeptical but now I’m amazed and grateful! They do NOT work if she’s already nauseous. At least not right away. You’ve gotta put them on ahead of time and in the right spot .
customer_reviews.author: chelsea mckell

customer_reviews.title: Life savor!
customer_reviews.text: I've avoided going out on the boat with family for years. As soon as I step on one I instantly have to get sick. I was sick of missing out on the fun so when I saw these I was skeptical but wanted to give them a try. Life changer! We were out on the water all day and I didn't feel sick at all, not even once. Cannot recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: MufasaRex

customer_reviews.title: As good as Rx
customer_reviews.text: I can't afford the ondansetron (generic of zofran) anti nausea dissolvable pills that kick in fast to relieve sudden onset of nausea and fight off strong feelings of needing to vomit. So, I bought the gum to take the edge off. It kicks in immediately, and generally works completely, with occasional need to use more gum.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works great for mild pregnancy morning sickness.
customer_reviews.text: I loved mine with my initial morning sickness but mine got pretty severe carrying twins. These would have worked better for normal morning sickness with my first. If you’re looking for something to help with car sickness or mind morning sickness then these are fantastic. However, if it’s more than that then ask your Dr. bands fit great on my small wrists. Came with an extra which is great because I work in a very dusty warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

product_meta.title: Sea-Band Anti-Nausea Acupressure Wristband for Motion or Morning Sickness, Adult, 1 Pair
product_meta.description: Style:Adult BandSea band the Original Wristband Adults 1 Pair, colors may vary
feature_bullets: SEA BAND: Sea Band, motion sickness wristbands, help relieve nausea from morning sickness, chemotherapy, surgery, car sickness, etc; Sea Band anti nausea wristbands are safe, reusable & washable
WRISTBAND FOR NAUSEA RELIEF: Sea Bands work by applying pressure to the P6 (Nei Kuan) acupressure point on each wrist; Applying pressure to this point has been proven to relieve nausea & vomiting
WAVE GOODBYE TO TRAVEL SICKNESS: Do you or your child suffer from motion sickness, sea sickness, or car sickness when you travel; Sea Band anti nausea products can help you feel better, naturally
THE NATURAL CHOICE FOR NAUSEA RELIEF: Inspired by traditional remedies, like herbs, aromatherapy, & acupressure, Sea Band nausea relief items help you feel better naturally, with no drug interactions
WHY SEA BAND? Sea Band wristbands, ginger drops, & gum for motion sickness, morning sickness, or other causes of nausea, give drug free nausea relief without side effects like drowsiness or fogginess

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
